title: Espionage case: After Jyoti, another YouTuber arrested; travelled to Pak thrice
content: Punjab Police's SSOC has exposed a terror-linked espionage network allegedly backed by Pakistan. Jasbir Singh, a YouTuber, is accused of maintaining contact with PIOs suspected of working for Pakistani handlers, including a previously arrested spy and an expelled Pakistani official. Singh's travels to Pakistan and interactions with Pakistani officials are under investigation, with seized devices undergoing forensic analysis.

title: From tears to triumph: Virat Kohli’s emotional IPL coronation after 18-year wait
content: Virat Kohli’s teary moment at Ahmedabad marked the end of an 18-year IPL title drought for RCB. Battling years of criticism, self-doubt, and heartbreak, Kohli rose like a phoenix to finally achieve his elusive dream. Though a subdued celebration followed, it might just be a start of something special.

title: Toxic love kills: 3 young women murdered by possessive partners in Delhi
content: Recent murders of three young women in Delhi, Komal, Vijaylaxmi, and Mehek Jain, highlight the dangers of possessive relationships. Fueled by jealousy and control, the perpetrators allegedly monitored their girlfriends on social media, particularly Instagram. Experts attribute this violence to deep-seated insecurities, unrealistic expectations, and the normalization of toxic behaviors, further exacerbated by social media's influence.

title: Watch: Bilawal Bhutto’s remark on Muslims in India hits a wall; reporter invokes Op Sindoor briefings
content: Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari alleged the demonization of Muslims in India at a UN press conference, a claim challenged by a journalist. The journalist pointed out that Muslim military officers, including Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, were involved in briefings regarding India's counter-terror operations following the Pahalgam attack. Operation Sindoor led to cross-border clashes until a ceasefire was established.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis: If I were a student right now, I would study ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: 6-year-old lured with chocolates, raped inside mosque in Karnataka's Chikkaballapura
content: In Karnataka's Chikkaballapura district, a shocking incident has unfolded where Mefuz, a 55-year-old merchant and father of a cleric, has been arrested. He is accused of raping a six-year-old girl inside a mosque.

title: ‘1 nation, 1 husband?’: Punjab CM Mann’s sindoor dig sparks BJP outrage
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann criticized the BJP's 'Operation Sindoor,' questioning its motives and sparking controversy. The BJP strongly reacted, accusing Mann of mocking a sensitive issue related to terrorism victims. AAP defended Mann, asserting that sindoor is a symbol of marital bliss, not a political tool.

title: Ukraine’s drone used my open-source code, says shocked developer: “Not in a million years did I think…”
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: ‘I don’t want upma’: 4-year-old Shanku’s viral demand video gets biryani added to anganwadi menu in Kerala
content: Aswathy Ashok posted a video of her son Shanku requesting biryani instead of upma. The video went viral. Kerala's Women and Child Development Minister Veena George noticed it. She promised to consider the request. George kept her word and included egg biryani in the revised anganwadi menu. The new menu also includes pulao.

title: Kamal Haasan’s Thug Life outpaces Akshay Kumar’s Housefull 5 in advance bookings
content: Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' is leading in advance bookings, grossing ₹3.42 crore, surpassing Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' which garnered ₹2.15 crore. 'Thug Life' dominates in Tamil Nadu, fueled by Kamal Haasan's comeback and Mani Ratnam's direction. Despite 'Housefull 5' appealing to a broader audience, 'Thug Life' is poised to potentially steal the box office spotlight.

title: 'Anushka, my mum, my brother …': Kohli fights back tears in an emotional interview
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli, overwhelmed with emotion, dedicated the victory to his family, especially his wife Anushka Sharma. He acknowledged their unwavering support throughout his 18-year journey with the team. Kohli emphasised his commitment to contributing to the team's success, both on and off the field.

title: Anand Mahindra on Carlsen’s reaction after losing to D Gukesh: ‘Wasn’t just a…’
content: D Gukesh, the youngest World Chess Champion, defeated Magnus Carlsen at the Norway Chess tournament, earning praise from Anand Mahindra. Gukesh's composed victory contrasted with Carlsen's frustration, marking a milestone in his career with his first classical win against the world champion. He now stands third in the tournament, closely trailing Carlsen and Caruana.

title: Trump admin reverses deportation order of four-year-old child
content: Following widespread condemnation, the Trump administration reversed its decision to revoke the legal status of Sofia Vargas, a four-year-old Mexican girl receiving life-saving treatment in the US. The family, who arrived in 2023, faced deportation after their humanitarian parole was terminated. Doctors warned Sofia would die without continued specialized care.

title: Why China 'turning off tap' may be another Pakistan bluff
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma refuted Pakistani concerns about China cutting off Brahmaputra's water supply, emphasizing the river's rain-fed nature within India. He stated that only a small percentage of the river's flow originates in China, with the majority coming from Indian monsoon rainfall.

title: Gender-neutral shift: JNU vice-chancellor to be called 'Kulguru' instead of 'Kulpati'
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has decided to replace 'Kulpati' with 'Kulguru' for its vice-chancellor on degree certificates and academic records, a decision made during an Executive Council meeting in April. The move aims for a more inclusive and gender-neutral title, aligning with similar changes in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan.

title: Bricks, blades & Thar: Instagram feud turns bloody in Noida, youth run over by SUV
content: In Noida's Sector 53, a social media feud escalated into a violent assault on Monday. Saurabh Yadav and his brother were attacked by a group, including Akash and Aman Awana, allegedly linked to illegal activities. The brothers were beaten, and Saurabh was nearly run over by a Thar.

title: Shift in tone? Bilawal seeks intel cooperation with India; underlines terror threat
content: Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari expressed Pakistan's willingness to cooperate with India in combating terrorism, advocating for a dispute resolution mechanism and joint efforts between intelligence agencies. Shashi Tharoor noted the heightened interest due to the simultaneous presence of Indian and Pakistani delegations in the US.

title: IPL: RCB head coach admits 'Operation Sindoor' gave them breathing space
content: RCB head coach Andy Flower revealed that the IPL 2025 suspension, gave injured players like Rajat Patidar and Josh Hazlewood vital recovery time. Flower also praised Patidar’s calm leadership and credited the unexpected break as a turning point in RCB’s journey to their maiden IPL title.

title: Mass shooting in Toronto: One dead, several injured with gunshot wounds; probe on
content: A shooting in Toronto's Lawrence Heights neighborhood on Tuesday night resulted in one fatality and five injuries. Toronto police and paramedics responded to the incident near Flemington and Zachary Roads, where they found one man dead at the scene.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers' Mehul Kothari recommends buying Gujarat State Fertilizers & Chemicals (GSFC) due to a falling trendline breakout and bullish signals. Indegene is identified as a breakout candidate with rising volumes, while Redington presents a pullback buy opportunity after retesting a breakout zone and displaying a bullish engulfing pattern.

title: Indore honeymooner’s case: SP confirms murder after body found in Meghalaya gorge
content: Indore honeymooner Raja Raghuvanshi was murdered with a machete near Weisawdong falls in Sohra, police confirmed after his body was discovered. His wife, Sonam, remains missing as the investigation intensifies to uncover the motive behind the crime. The family suspects foul play and demands a CBI investigation, alleging crucial search efforts were initially ignored.

title: RCB’s Man Friday: Krunal Pandya turns IPL final on its head
content: Riding on Krunal Pandya's excellent bowling, Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Punjab Kings to win their first IPL title. Krunal Pandya also became the first player to win the Player of the Match award in two IPL finals, having also done that in 2017.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 24,550; BSE Sensex up over 150 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was above 24,550, BSE Sensex was up over 150 points.

title: 'Loyalty carves legacies': Mahindra hails Kohli's 18-year wait for IPL glory
content: Virat Kohli's 18-year quest for an IPL title concluded triumphantly as Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Kohli's crucial 43 runs contributed significantly to RCB's victory. Anand Mahindra lauded Kohli's unwavering loyalty, stating it carves legacies. Mahindra highlighted Kohli's dedication to RCB, emphasising that the stars finally aligned after years of anticipation.

title: Ex-BJP mandal chief shot dead in Dehradun after quarrel over 'friend's relationship with girl'
content: In Dehradun's Premnagar, BJP's former mandal president, Rohit Negi, was fatally shot late Tuesday night. The attack occurred as Negi and his friends were returning home after dinner. Accused Azhar Tyagi from Muzaffarnagar, along with an accomplice, ambushed Negi's car following a heated phone argument allegedly sparked by a friend's relationship.

title: Degrees that deliver: 5 college majors with high return on investment globally
content: Globally, degrees in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Medicine, Law, and Data Science offer high returns on investment. Strong job markets and affordable education systems in countries like Germany and the UK enhance the financial benefits. These fields provide graduates with lucrative career opportunities and location flexibility.

title: Sharmishta Panoli row: Man who filed plaint against influencer ‘untraceable’; cops slap FIRs
content: Wazahat Khan Qadri, whose FIR led to the arrest of an Instagram influencer, has become untraceable, prompting investigations across multiple states. He faces several FIRs in Kolkata, Assam, and Delhi for allegedly denigrating Hindu deities and inciting communal tensions. Qadri's father claims his son is innocent and that his accounts were possibly hacked, citing threats received since the influencer's arrest.

title: Trump’s 50% tariff on steel and aluminium comes into effect; Here's what we know
content: US president Trump has signed an order doubling tariffs on imported steel and aluminum to 50%, citing national security concerns and aiming to protect domestic industries from foreign dumping. While tariffs on UK imports remain at 25%, the hike targets other partners, prompting warnings of retaliation from the European Union and Mexico seeking an exemption, adding pressure to ongoing trade talks.

title: Musk calls Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' a 'disgusting abomination'; White House reacts
content: Elon Musk has publicly criticized President Trump's "Big Beautiful Bill," calling it a "disgusting abomination" that will bankrupt America. Musk, who recently left his government role, claims the bill will massively increase the budget deficit.

title: Chhattisgarh: Driver opens door at 100kmph to spit gutka, man dies in crash; 3 hurt
content: In Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur, a speeding Innova crashed, killing a businessman. The driver opened the door to spit gutkha, losing control. The vehicle flipped, hitting other vehicles. Jackie Gehi died on the spot. Akash Chandani and Pankaj Chhabra were critically injured. The accident occurred on the Bilaspur-Raipur highway. Police arrived and sealed off the area. The injured were hospitalized.

title: "#IStandWithKamalHaasan" trends as fans back actor amid 'Thug Life' Karnataka release row
content: Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' will not release in Karnataka due to controversy over his comments on the Kannada language's origins. He declined to apologize, leading to an estimated Rs 12-15 crore loss. Despite this, Haasan has garnered significant support, with fans defending his statements as rooted in linguistic history and not intended as an insult.

title: Kohli takes IPL trophy to RCB fans: 'Loyalty paying rent after 18 years' - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's unwavering 18-year dedication to Royal Challengers Bengaluru culminated in a historic Indian Premier League victory against Punjab Kings at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Tuesday. Kohli, an integral part of RCB since 2008, celebrated the momentous occasion with jubilant fans, symbolising the reward for his steadfast loyalty.

title: India accepted Pak's call for de-escalation, but not immediately: CDS
content: General Anil Chauhan revealed that Pakistan's Operation to cripple India in 48 hours on May 10th, dubbed 'Operation Sindoor,' collapsed within eight. India's networked air defense, AI-driven analysis, and non-contact warfare capabilities, including cyber and electromagnetic domains, forced Pakistan to seek de-escalation talks after realizing their multi-pronged attacks had failed. India connected terror to water and redrew military operation lines.

title: RCB win IPL: Kohli ends 18-year wait; Krunal, Patidar, Livingstone and Jitesh script victory
content: After 18 years of heartbreak, near-misses, and relentless criticism, Royal Challengers Bengaluru finally ended their IPL title drought. In a thrilling final against Punjab Kings, RCB held their nerve to clinch a six-run victory. Although Virat Kohli wasn’t at his best, the team’s collective effort — led by Krunal Pandya, Rajat Patidar, and others — ensured that the long-awaited dream was finally realised.

title: How to reduce arm fat: 5 easy dumbbell exercises that can be done at home
content: Targeting arm toning is a common fitness goal, especially during summer. This article suggests incorporating dumbbell exercises into your routine to build muscle and reduce arm fat. It outlines five simple exercises that can be performed at home, including bicep curls, plié V raises, arm circles, tricep kickbacks, and overhead dumbbell presses, to help achieve toned arms.

title: Found & released: 3 Indians missing in Iran rescued by cops in Tehran; all you need to know
content: Three Indian nationals from Punjab, who had been missing in Iran since May 1 while en route to Australia with promises of lucrative jobs, have been rescued by Tehran police. The men were freed following a police operation in south Tehran's Varamin against their hostage-takers.

title: 'This is equally theirs too': Kohli dedicates RCB’s IPL win to ABD & Gayle
content: Star batter Virat Kohli dedicated Royal Challengers Bengaluru's Indian Premier League 2025 victory to AB de Villiers and Chris Gayle, acknowledging their immense contributions to the franchise. Kohli emphasised the trio's shared pursuit of the title and the significance of having De Villiers and Gayle present during the momentous occasion.

title: Measles virus can stay in the air for up to 2 hours: Here's how to stay safe
content: Measles cases are surging globally, with the U.S. experiencing its worst outbreak since 2020. The CDC advises travelers to get vaccinated against measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) before traveling internationally, as the virus spreads through respiratory droplets and can linger in the air for hours.

title: Watch: Kohli, Patidar show off their moves as RCB celebrate historic IPL win
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru won their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Rajat Patidar-led RCB defended a score of 190 as Virat Kohli's emotional reaction became a highlight. The No 18 and his teammates bust out some moves after the thrilling win upon reaching the team hotel.

title: Quad ministers set to meet soon, clear decks for summit India will host
content: Quad foreign ministers are expected to convene in Washington soon, setting the stage for a summit in India later this year. The meeting aims to reinforce the group's commitment to a free and open Indo-Pacific region amid ongoing trade discussions with China.

title: 'Ee Sala Cup Namde': Vijay Mallya leads tributes after RCB’s IPL win
content: After 18 years of anticipation, Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) clinched their first IPL title, sparking emotional reactions from former owner Vijay Mallya and the entire cricketing world. Mallya expressed his joy on X, reminiscing about the team's journey. Virat Kohli, overwhelmed with emotion, symbolised the end of a long wait as RCB finally achieved victory, celebrated by fellow IPL teams.

title: AAP disengages from INDIA bloc, says alliance was only for 2024 LS polls
content: AAP has declared its departure from the INDIA bloc, asserting that the alliance served its purpose during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. The party alleged a covert, corrupt agreement between the BJP and Congress, accusing them of prioritizing mutual political survival over public welfare.

title: Watch: RCB title celebrations turn chaotic as police use lathis to control fans
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final, sparking massive celebrations in Bengaluru. However, the joyous street celebrations around SVP Chowk in Kalaburagi turned chaotic, leading to police intervention. Videos show officers using force to control the crowds, drawing criticism for excessive measures against the celebrating fans, though celebrations continued.

title: Why now? Who's next? Five big Knicks questions after firing Tom Thibodeau
content: NBA insiders examine why the Knicks parted ways with Thibodeau and which coaching candidates could be right for New York.

title: Knicks fire Thibodeau after best run in 25 years
content: The Knicks are firing head coach Tom Thibodeau just a week after he led the team to its first Eastern Conference finals in 25 years.

title: More men allege sexual misconduct by ex-IU doc
content: At least 15 former Indiana men's basketball players are alleging improper sexual conduct by a former team physician and saying Indiana officials, including the late coach Bobby Knight, were aware of the behavior.

title: Cora irked as BoSox fall again: 'Not getting better'
content: Manager Alex Cora is running out of excuses for the slumping Red Sox. He let his frustrations fly in the aftermath of Tuesday's 4-3 loss to the Angels, proclaiming that his team continues to repeat the same mistakes and isn't getting better.

title: Rockies' 1st series win since '24 ends record streak
content: The league-worst Rockies won consecutive games for only the second time this year to end a streak of 22 consecutive series losses dating to last season.

title: McCullers outduels Skenes for 1st win since '22
content: Lance McCullers Jr. pitched six sparkling innings for his first win since 2022 as the Astros beat the Pirates 3-0 on Tuesday night.

title: New G McDonald helps end Clark-less Fever's skid
content: The Fever won their first game since point guard Caitlin Clark was injured, getting a lift from emergency hardship signing Aari McDonald in a win over Washington.

title: Seahawks HC scoffs at notion Darnold won't start
content: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald offered strong support of Sam Darnold after the quarterback struggled some during the first OTA that was open to reporters.

title: Barber details medical emergency that nixed fight
content: UFC flyweight Maycee Barber told ESPN on Tuesday that a medical complication in her locker room during warmups Saturday led to the last-minute cancellation of her UFC Fight Night bout against Erin Blanchfield.

title: 👀 Three potential trade offers for Cooper Flagg
content: What if the Mavs traded the draft's top pick? Our NBA insiders offer three enticing offers -- and a verdict.

content: SGA or Tyrese Haliburton for the top spot? Which conference finals stars cracked the list? We weigh in.

content: Does the SEC remain on top? Will Boise State revisit the CFP? Here's what stands out from ESPN's latest data.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter to offer Højlund an escape from Man United
content: Rasmus Højlund looks set to leave Man United, with Inter Milan keen to bring the striker back to Serie A. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Betting interest on Fever games dips by half after Caitlin Clark injury
content: Caitlin Clark's quad injury has had a ripple effect on the WNBA, including the betting interest in the Indiana Fever and the sport over the past week.

title: Recap of 'The Ultimate Fighter' Episode 2 and everything else you need to know
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: There's more to Merab Dvalishvili's game than just takedowns
content: The UFC bantamweight champion will try to take Sean O'Malley to the mat at UFC 316. What he does from there will determine if he keeps the belt.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Charlo returns, Plant down four spots at super middleweight
content: Jermell Charlo's victory brings him back to the top 10 at 168 pounds, but where does he land? Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

content: Mark Kriegel's excerpt from "Baddest Man: The Making of Mike Tyson" looks at the fights of a 14-year-old Tyson.

title: Odds, post positions for the Belmont Stakes
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: Sentnor nets two as USWNT cruises past Jamaica
content: Ally Sentnor scored twice in the first half and Lynn Biyendolo added two in the second as the United States eased past Jamaica in a friendly in Saint Louis, Missouri, on Tuesday night.

title: Pochettino: Pulisic should be the Messi of the U.S.
content: United States men's national team head coach Mauricio Pochettino said Christian Pulisic should be the Lionel Messi of the U.S. due to his talent and recognizability.

title: Penalty law changed after Álvarez controversy
content: The laws on taking a penalty kick were clarified Tuesday after Julián Álvarez's accidental double touch helped to eliminate Atlético Madrid from the Champions League.

title: Luna: Broken nose 'life-changing' for U.S. career
content: Real Salt Lake and United States midfielder Diego Luna said that the broken nose he sustained in a friendly against Costa Rica in January was a "life-changing" event for him.

title: Bruno rejects 'ambitious' Saudi offer for Utd stay
content: Manchester United attacker Bruno Fernandes will stay at the club this summer after revealing on Tuesday that he turned down a "very ambitious" offer from Saudi Pro League side Al Hilal.

title: Sancho confirms Chelsea exit; returns to Man Utd
content: Jadon Sancho has confirmed his departure from Chelsea ahead of his return to Manchester United following the end of his season-long loan at Stamford Bridge.

title: Inzaghi leaves Inter amid reported Saudi interest
content: Inter Milan have confirmed that Simone Inzaghi has left the club following the team's 5-0 Champions League final defeat to PSG on Saturday.

title: Chicago Fire unveil plan for new $650m stadium
content: The Chicago Fire unveiled plans to build a privately funded, soccer-specific stadium along the Chicago River on Tuesday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: AC Milan closing in on Real Madrid's Luka Modric
content: AC Milan are closing in on former Real Madrid midfielder Luka Modric. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: Alternative soccer tournaments driven by celebrities, viral moments and huge cash prizes are all the rage. Are they the future of the sport, too?

content: While it promises benefits for working-class Americans, critics argue it could hurt the most vulnerable, moreover, both - Republicans and Democrats express fears that they may lose their access to vital government services.

title: Gateway Of India To Navi Mumbai In Just 40 Minutes? Mumbai To Get Water Taxis Soon
content: The water taxis will run from the Radio Jetty at the Gateway of India to the Navi Mumbai Airport, officials said.

title: Pak's 'Islamic Solidarity' Bid To Derail India Plan -- And A Malaysian Snub
content: Pakistan tried to derail the Indian delegation's visit to Malaysia, citing Islamic solidarity, but Kuala Lumpur rejected Islamabad's interference, top sources have told NDTV.

title: "Executive Twice Superseded Seniormost Judges": Chief Justice's Collegium Push
content: The government superseded the seniormost judges twice while appointing the Chief Justice of India when it had the final say in judges' appointment, Chief Justice of India BR Gavai has said.

title: "The Way My Wife Has Been...": Imran Khan's Big Claim On Asim Munir
content: Imran Khan spoke about the "vindictive nature" of Army Chief Gen Asim Munir saying the field marshal turned against his wife, Bushra Bibi, after being removed from the post of director general of Inter-Services Intelligence.

title: Fearing Building Collapse, Over 200 Inmates Escape Pak Jail During Earthquakes
content: Karachi's Malir Jail houses at least 5,000 prisoners and is home to some of the country's most high-profile inmates, including terrorists.

title: "Judges Must Be Free": Chief Justice's Big Remark On Collegium System"
content: The government superseded the seniormost judges twice while appointing the Chief Justice of India when it had the final say in judges' appointment, Chief Justice of India BR Gavai has said.

title: What Is Fusarium Graminearum, Smuggled By Chinese Woman, Boyfriend Into US
content: Two Chinese nationals have been charged with smuggling a dangerous agricultural pathogen into the United States. Authorities say the pathogen could be used as a biological weapon.

title: 1 Dead, 5 Hospitalised After Mass Shooting In Toronto
content: One person has died and several others have been injured after a mass shooting incident in Canada's Toronto. According to local media, the shooting took place in Lawrence Heights neighbourhood of North York.

title: Markets Rebound After 3-Day Decline, Sensex Gains 230 Points In Early Trade
content: The 30-share BSE Sensex climbed 230.17 points to 80,967.68 in early trade. The NSE Nifty went up by 70.25 points to 24,612.75.

title: "Thailand A Freer Country": Gay Chinese Couple Fulfil Wedding Dream
content: When Wang Zengyi, 41, and Song Jihan, 29, first met at a friend's dinner party in China, it was love at first sight.

title: "Patience Zaroori Hai": Delhi Police's Viral Post After RCB Wins IPL After 18 Years
content: Celebrating RCB's win, the Delhi Police shared a post to draw home a point about being patient and not driving before you turn 18.

title: PM Modi Congratulates South Korea President On Election Victory
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Wednesday that he wanted to "expand and strengthen" ties with South Korea, sending congratulations as centre-left President Lee Jae-myung took office.

title: "As Far As Kashmir Cause Is Concerned...": Bilawal Bhutto's Big UN Admission
content: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, the former Foreign Minister of Pakistan and Chairman of the Pakistan People's Party (PPP), has publicly acknowledged that Islamabad's efforts to raise the Kashmir issue at international forums have faced persistent setbacks.

title: 9 Of Family Dead After Cement-Laden Truck Overturns On Van In Madhya Pradesh
content: The accident took place at around 2.30 am when the victims, belonging to the same family, were returning from a marriage function.

title: In Indore Missing Couple Case, Cops Find Out How Husband Was Murdered
content: The Madhya Pradesh man, whose body was recovered from a deep gorge 11 days after he and his wife went missing during their trip to Meghalaya, was allegedly murdered with a machete, police officers said, as the crime sent shockwaves across the state.

title: A Summer That Isn't? Why 2025 Is Becoming Climate Case Study for India
content: A January that didn't feel like winter and a May that did not feel like summer - the year 2025 is emerging as a case study in understanding the impact of climate change in India.

title: Chinese Woman, Boyfriend Arrested For Smuggling Biological Pathogen Into US
content: According to an FBI criminal complaint, Zunyong Liu, 34, a researcher currently in China, brought the fungus into the United States while visiting his girlfriend, Yunqing Jian, 33, in July 2024.

title: Trump's $5 Million Gold Card To Be "Incredibly Successful" In India: Top US Official
content: The top US official said it is a wonderful opportunity for people to be part of two economies and people will be able to come to the US.

content: Max Verstappen is already on the back foot in the F1 title fight. His Spain outburst didn't help his cause.

title: Dhruvi Acharya’s landmark solo exhibition at Hampi Art Labs till September
content: The Journey is Home, curated by noted art critic Girish Shahane, features an expansive collection of Dhruvi Acharya’s works, ranging from her early creations to more recent pieces

content: From asking lorry drivers to perform a celebratory honk to autorickshaws spinning on the road like in a video game, the city was gripped in a frenzy

title: Kerala police file chargesheet against businessman Boby Chemmanur
content: The chargesheet is a follow-up of the SIT probe following a woman actor’s complaint against Boby Chemmanur of making sexually loaded comments against her on social media and also personally while attending an event.

title: Family of youngster missing for almost a year ago moves Kerala HC for CBI probe
content: The police have been coordinating with their counterparts in other States like Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Delhi, and even Himachal Pradesh

title: Over 12 shops destroyed in fire at market in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur
content: Prima facie, it seems a short-circuit triggered the fire, an official said, adding an investigation was underway.

title: Assam flood remains grim with heavy rain resulting in water level rise
content: Around 6.5 lakh affected in Assam due to heavy rain; Brahmaputra flowing above the danger level, IMD predicts heavy to very heavy rainfall at isolated places in the State.

title: Maharashtra government to transfer Kurla land parcel to DRPPL, Congress opposes
content: Ms. Gaikwad raised questions about the government handing over this land to Adani when the Dharavi residents will be rehabilitated in Dharavi itself.

title: Aequs files for an IPO on a confidential basis
content: Board passes resolution; the offer will comprise both a fresh issue of equity shares and an offer for sale (OFS) component, according to company’s regulatory filings.

title: India and U.S. can only finalise ‘mini’ trade deal this year: Sources
content: This comes at a time when US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick has said that a trade deal between India and the United States will materialise in the “not too distant future”.

title: 9 killed, two injured as truck overturns on van in Madhya Pradesh
content: The victims include two children, aged around 4 years, two teens, aged around 15, three women, and two men

title: Six sisters drown in the Yamuna after one girl ‘trips in the sludge’
content: The accident happened when one of the girls slipped. As they were holding each other’s hands, all of them drowned, police said

title: Raipur village fights eviction for ‘MLA colony’
content: Villagers allege land is being cleared for MLA colony; authorities cite encroachment on government land

title: India, U.K. discuss ways to boost ties in key sectors
content: The Indian delegation was led by Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri while the U.K. side was headed by Sir Oliver Robbins, Permanent Under-Secretary (PUS) at Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

title: Uddhav doesn’t need an enemy, he has Sanjay Raut: BJP leader
content: Responding to Sanjay Raut’s remark that Girish Mahajan was a potential deserter, the BJP MLA from north Maharashtra hit back and alleged that brokers like Sanjay Raut have driven leaders and grassroots workers away from the Shiv Sena (UBT)

title: Land-for-jobs case: Railway Ministry exerted excessive pressure to clear applications, claims CBI
content: According to CBI's chargesheet, the candidates directly or through their relatives, sold land to Lalu Prasad at highly discounted rates and that Lalu's family acquired over 1 lakh sq ft of land for only ₹26 lakh as against the circle rate of more than ₹4.39 crore

title: R.P.G.V. Govindan Chettiyar, the unsung freedom fighter from Erode
content: The untold story of freedom fighter Govindan Chettiyar, a forgotten hero of Tamil Nadu’s independence struggle

title: Three missing Indians in Iran rescued by police: embassy
content: Local media in Iran say police have found and released three Indian men who had gone missing in Iran, the embassy said

title: Kerala HC sets aside tribunal’s order rejecting Waqf board’s plea
content: The court passed the directive while allowing a petition filed by the Waqf board challenging the tribunal’s order

title: NDA government resorting to vendetta politics, alleges YSRCP
content: Former MLA Karunakar Reddy accuses the government of encouraging land mafia, sand mining, and liquor syndicate

title: Andhra Pradesh to host a cricket World Cup match after 28 years
content: Dr. YSR ACA-VDCA cricket stadium in Vizag figures among the four Indian venues for ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 tournament, beginning September 30

title: CPI(M) slams Venugopal’s remarks about welfare pension
content: Mr. Govindan termed the alleged remark as “baseless” and claimed that it was intended to mislead the public

title: Palaniswami criticises DMK government over issues in State-run universities, higher education
content: Mr. Palaniswami cited claims about financial crunch affecting State-run universities in the State, declining student admissions, alleged irregularities, among others

title: Complete four ports and four fishing harbours by December next year, Naidu tells officials
content: Logistics Corporation will be set up to realise goals of road, port, airport, and fishing harbour projects, he says and calls for a plan to build heliports in Agency areas

title: When Kamal Haasan changed his movie’s title after finding no support from Jayalalithaa
content: During a controversy over the movie name Sandiyar, Kamal Haasan tried to meet the then Chief Minister Jayalalithaa hoping to sort out the issue, however, she did not grant him an audience immediately

title: Kishan Reddy demands proper maintenance of streetlights
content: He urged the government to take immediate steps to restore street lighting and ensure CCTV connectivity to help prevent crimes such as chain snatching and eve teasing

title: 34 tourists, family members of army personnel airlifted from Sikkim’s landslide hit Chaten
content: Three army personnel were killed and six soldiers went missing after a landslide hit a military camp at Chaten

title: How dangerous is 'toxic fungus' Chinese researchers allegedly tried to smuggle into US?
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Ensure flawless arrangements for Yoga Day in Visakhapatnam on June 21, says Naidu
content: The goal is to create a Guinness World Record with the participation of five lakh people, the Chief Minister says, and suggests that two major pre-events be conducted on June 7 and 14 to motivate and ready the participants for the main event

title: Union Minister of State for Defence announces plan to expand NCC by three lakh cadets
content: Several States already extending their concurrence and committing to fast-track the necessary training infrastructure, he says

title: Rajasthan State employee who was detained earlier arrested for espionage
content: The accused, Shakur Khan, was earlier detained on May 28 and subjected to an intensive interrogation by multiple agencies

title: State, Centre agree to bring Sabari rail project on track
content: Decision taken at a meeting of Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in New Delhi on Tuesday.  An expert committee will visit Kerala in July

title: ‘Power outage in NEET centres did not impact students’ performance’
content: Additional Solicitor General AR.L. Sundaresan tells Justice C. Kumarappan that the test was conducted in broad daylight and hence the candidates were able to mark the OMR sheets properly

title: Cup Namdu!: RCB fans ecstatic as Bengaluru team wins maiden IPL trophy
content: Excitement in the city had begun early in the day with people buying RCB merchandise and organising public screenings

title: Thiruneermalai temple tank cries for maintenance; activists, devotees call for remediation measures
content: The sacred tank of the Sri Rangathaperumal Temple in Thiruneermalai  lacks maintenance, and anti-social activities take place near it, says a devotee; recently, a protest was staged over the poor condition of the tank, and to demand its immediate restoration

title: Prepare for heavy rain, floods in Hyderabad, CM Revanth tells officials
content: Meeting discusses expediting the completion of pending drainage and desilting works, identifying problematic areas and taking preventive measures

title: Three COVID-19 samples from Telangana sent for genome sequencing, all belong to LF.7.9 variant: INSACOG
content: The State, which had zero active cases until a few weeks ago, has now begun sending positive samples for genome sequencing as a precautionary measure

title: Tamil Nadu moves Supreme Court against Madras High Court’s stay on Vice-Chancellor appointment laws
content: The High Court had ordered a stay despite the Supreme Court, in an April 8, 2025 judgment, having invoked its inherent powers under Article 142 of the Constitution to deem that the Bills were assented to by Governor R.N. Ravi.

title: New entrance to Kengeri railway station to ease access and boost commuter safety
content: At present, many commuters cross the trolley path to move between the Metro and railway stations, risking their safety in the absence of a proper connecting route

title: SGTs must be promoted as headmasters in primary schools, not sidelined: APPTA
content: The leaders warned that if the government failed to address the issue, it could lead to statewide protests by SGTs

title: Sulphur-cleaning device in coal plants not necessary: Central scientific committee
content: 92% of India’s 600 coal plant units are yet to install FGDs; panel recommends exemption of 80% which are not near major population centres; report says FGDs may increase long-lived CO2 emissions while reducing short-lived SO2

title: Indian delegation seeks to sensitise U.K. lawmakers to Pakistan-sponsored terror attacks
content: Members of the multi-party delegation said that their British interlocutors were receptive to India’s concerns and sympathetic to its situation.

title: Tension at Palayam Market over demolition of shops
content: After initial attempt to remove materials from inside the shops and demolish the buildings were prevented by a section of the protesting traders, the drive continued with the support of the police

title: Many tongues, one Constitution: Alternative Law Forum brings out Preamble in Karnataka’s languages
content: Ashwini Bodh has been working to bring out the Indian Constitution preamble in the different languages of Karnataka and so far, has succeeded in reproducing it in Aruvu, Byari, Iruliga, Lambani, Malame, and Sankethi.

title: Madras High Court judge, wife visit litigant’s bed-ridden father at home to ascertain his mental condition
content: Justice G.R. Swaminathan took his wife Kamakshi along, since she was a special educator with experience in dealing with mentally ill persons, and the couple found the octogenarian to be perfectly all right

title: As Kamal has decided against release of Thug Life in Karnataka, trade analysts expect 7% loss in total gross revenue
content: According to producer and distributor G. Dhananjayan, the production house is likely to face a loss of ₹35 crore to ₹40 crore in gross box office revenue and a loss of ₹12 crore to ₹15 crore in producer share, if the film does not release in the neighbouring State

title: BJD accuses Odisha BJP State president of submitting false affidavits
content: The regional party demands Manmohan Samal, State BJP president, respond to show-cause notice issued by State Bar Council

title: Calcutta HC allows pleas challenging WBSSC teacher recruitment notification
content: Petitioners claim 2025 rules contravene Supreme Court directive; vacation Bench likely to hear case this week

title: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla’s mission to International Space Station postponed to June 10
content: Mr. Shukla will be the second Indian to travel to space four decades after Rakesh Sharma's iconic spaceflight onboard Russia's Soyuz spacecraft in 1984.

title: Sacrificial slaughter not permitted in public places during Bakrid in Sambhal
content: The district administration held a peace committee meeting with various stakeholders, including representatives from areas where Eid prayers will be conducted

title: PM Modi will inaugurate Vande Bharat train service from Katra to Srinagar on June 6
content: Prior to the Pahalgam terror attack, Mr. Modi was set to travel to Srinagar for the inauguration. Now, he will flag off the train from Katra on Jammu side, officials said.

title: Motion of impeachment against Justice Varma likely during Monsoon Session
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju says he has started speaking to political parties to build consensus over this ‘non-political issue’.

title: Rahul Gandhi accuses PM Modi of ‘surrendering’ to U.S. pressure over Indo-Pak ceasefire
content: Congress leader cites Trump’s alleged intervention, asserts party’s commitment to ideological fight and social justice

title: Mayawati hits out at Bihar govt over death of Dalit rape victim
content: The former U.P. CM and a leading Dalit face pushed for strict legal action against all culprits and asked the Bihar government to ensure justice to the victim’s family

title: CPCL reworking configuration of Nagapattinam refinery, says its MD
content: The company is also looking at venturing into retail sales of petroleum products and about ₹400 crore has been set aside for the purpose, says MD H. Shankar

title: No contempt if Parliament, legislatures simply make laws: Supreme Court
content: "Every State Legislature has plenary powers to pass an enactment and so long as the said enactment has not been declared to be ultra vires the Constitution or, in any way, null and void by a constitutional court, the said enactment would have the force of law," says Bench

title: Jamaat condemns incidents of violence against Muslims
content: Country has witnessed a pattern of mob lynchings and hate crimes against Muslims, Dalits, and other marginalised groups in recent years, often under the guise of cow protection or love jihad, says vice-president of Jamaat-e-Islami Hind

title: 'As wired at breakfast as he is at game time': What Brad Marchand has brought to the Panthers
content: "the last game I thought I was ever going to play in a Bruins jersey," he says . a rematch between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers is an "incredible final" he didn't want to leave the team that drafted him in 2006 .

title: Musk's 'DOGE goons' left rats, cockroaches, marijuana behind: Report amid Ketamine claims

title: How NiJaree Canady became college softball's first million-dollar player
content: the 2024 USA Collegiate Softball player of the year is reshaping college softball . she landed the richest softball deal ever . her new home would be on the arid plains of west Texas at a school .

title: Regrading last summer's biggest transfers: Which club earned an A? Which got a D?
content: from 1992 through 2021, just 54% of all the players brought in for €10 million started at least 50% of the matches in their first two seasons . 370 premier league clubs made 370 signings for the past season . only 25 were on the field for 70% of the minutes .

title: Madden NFL 26 cover star Saquon Barkley's ratings throughout his career
content: saquon Barkley is the cover star of the upcoming iteration of the football sim . he is the first member of the 99 club -- the illustrious circle of athletes starting the season with a 99 OVR . his debut performance, which netted him NFL Offensive Rookie of the Year, added nine points to his initial rating .

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: this is the first time the ACC has more super regional teams than the SEC since 2008 . UTSA and u.s. are making their first appearances in super regionals . the top two seeds are eliminated in the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship .

title: Blockbuster semifinal at the French Open: Will Swiatek or Sabalenka win?
content: aryna Sabalenka and Iga Swiatek face off in the semifinals at the french open on friday . the two have played 12 times, with the pair leading 8-4 overall and 5-1 on clay . femail's samir khan is the world's no. 1 for the first time since the semis .

title: Prospect rankings, next to debut for all 30 MLB teams
content: we've entered June, meaning it's time for our next team-by-team MLB prospect rankings big board update . the top 10 prospects for all 30 teams are updated below . players in the big leagues are eligible for this update as MLB rookie eligibility rules apply here .

title: Why the Panthers will win the Stanley Cup (again)
content: a rematch between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers is "an incredible final" he wants to see Connor McDavid rewarded for his 10 years of trying to will the Oilers to their first Stanley Cup since 1990 . he is voted the playoffs' most valuable player moments after losing in the championship finale .

title: Injury outlook for 2025: Players to monitor
